message:
SYSTEM: 05_OWL.pdf: Página 7
© O. Corcho, MC Suárez de Figueroa Baonza
9
OWL 2
Most common constructors in class definitions
•
Intersection: C1 ∩... ∩Cn
Human ∩Male
•
Union: C1 ∪... ∪Cn
Doctor ∪Lawyer
•
Negation: ¬C
¬Male
•
Nominals: {x1} ∪... ∪{xn}
{john} ∪... ∪{mary}
•
Universal restriction: ∀P.C
∀hasChild.Doctor
•
Existential restriction: ∃P.C
∃hasChild.Lawyer
•
Maximum cardinality: ≤nP.C
≤3hasChild.Doctor
•
Minimum cardinality: ≥nP.C
≥1hasChild.Male
•
Specific Value: ∃P.{x}
∃hasColleague.{Matthew}
•
Nesting of constructors can be arbitrarily complex
–
Person ∩∀hasChild.(Doctor ∪∃hasChild.Doctor)
•
Lots of redundancy
–
A∪B is equivalent to ¬(¬ A ∩¬B)
–
∃P.C is equivalent to ¬∀P. ¬C
speaker: SYSTEM
